IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO PROVIDE A QUALITY SECONDARY INDEPENDENT SCHOOL EDUCATION TO APPROXIMATELY 865 STUDENTS PER YEAR.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO PROVIDE A QUALITY SECONDARY INDEPENDENT SCHOOL EDUCATION TO APPROXIMATELY 865 STUDENTS PER YEAR.
IRS990.Desc: THE SCHOOL EDUCATES (ACADEMICALLY, RESIDENTIALLY AND ATHLETICALLY) APPROXIMATELY 865 STUDENTS, GENERATING OVER $34 MILLION OF NET TUITION AND FEES, THROUGH THE EFFORTS OF DEDICATED FACULTY AND SUPPORT.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: THE SCHOOL MAINTAINS ABOUT 1.3 MILLION SQUARE FEET OF RESIDENTIAL, ACADEMIC AND ATHLETIC SPACE FOR A COMMUNITY OF OVER 1,000 MEMBERS. THE MAJORITY OF THIS EXPENSE REFLECTS THE DEPRECIATION ON THE SCHOOL PROPERTY, PLANT AND EQUIPMENT, WHICH HAS A CURRENT ACCOUNTING VALUE OF $142.2 MILLION.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: THE SCHOOL DISCOUNTS TUITION IN THE FORM OF FINANCIAL AID AT AN APPROXIMATE RATE OF 25% IN AN EFFORT TO RECRUIT AND RETAIN THE MOST TALENTED STUDENT BODY. THE SCHOOL RECOGNIZES THAT A DIVERSE STUDENT BODY BETTERS THE OVERALL EXPERIENCE FOR ALL INVOLVED, AND THAT WHILE NOT EVERYONE CAN CONTRIBUTE FINANCIALLY IN TERMS OF TUITION, EVERYONE HAS SOMETHING TO OFFER THE CHOATE ROSEMARY HALL COMMUNITY.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: MANAGEMENT FEES FOR FOOD SERVICE AND HOUSEKEEPING EXPENSES
ALL OTHER PROGRAM RELATED EXPENSES, INCLUDING ADVERTISING, ROYALTIES, INTEREST PAYMENTS, OUTSIDE RENTALS, ETC.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE INTENDED USE OF THE ENDOWMENT FUNDS IS TO SUPPORT THE ORGANIZATION'S MISSION OF PROVIDING A QUALITY EDUCATION TO STUDENTS.
FINANCIAL AID RECLASS -11,161,604. INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT FEE RECLASS -2,533,947. CHANGE IN VALUE OF SPLIT INTEREST OBLIGATIONS 50,659. BENEFITS PAID ON ANNUITY OBLIGATIONS -494,249.
RENTAL EXPENSES RECLASS -268,116. COST OF GOODS SOLD RECLASS -358,104. RECLASS POSTAGE RECHARGES 43,155.
COST OF GOODS SOLD RECLASS 358,104. RENTAL EXPENSES RECLASS 268,116. RECLASS POSTAGE RECHARGES -43,155.
FINANCIAL AID RECLASS 11,161,604. INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT FEES RECLASS 2,533,947. CHANGE IN VALUE OF SPLIT INTEREST AGREEMENTS -50,659.

A STATEMENT OF CHOATE'S NON-DISCRIMINATION POLICY IS INCLUDED IN ALL BROCHURES AND CATALOGS PERTAINING TO APPLICATIONS, FINANCIAL AID AND ENROLLMENT MATERIALS UTILIZED DURING STUDENT RECRUITMENT, MATRICULATION AND RE-ENROLLMENT, IS POSTED IN MULTIPLE LOCATIONS ON OUR WEB SITE, AND IS STATED IN ALUMNI PUBLICATIONS.
FINANCIAL AID IS PROVIDED VIA A REDUCTION IN TUITION.

THE SCHOOL REQUIRES THAT ITS SENIOR LEADERSHIP RESIDE ON CAMPUS AS A CONDITION OF EMPLOYMENT. ALL FACULTY WHO RESIDE IN SCHOOL HOUSING ARE REQUESTED TO SUBSTANTIATE THEIR "BUSINESS USE" OF THE FACILITY ONCE A YEAR. ALL FACULTY ARE REQUIRED TO PROVIDE SERVICES TOWARD THE RESIDENTIAL LIFE PROGRAM AT CHOATE ROSEMARY HALL. THE SCHOOL DOES NOT REIMBURSE EXPENSES FOR HOUSING AND PERSONAL SERVICES.
AN AGREED UPON PAYMENT OF $86,243 WAS MADE TO BENJAMIN GARDNER. ALEXANDER CURTIS PARTICPATES IN A 457(F) PLAN.

IssuerName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: CONNECTICUT HEALTH AND EDUCATIONAL FACILITIES AUTHORITY

TaxExemptBondsIssuesGrp.PurposeDesc: SERIES E BONDS WERE ISSUED TO REFINANCE SERIES D BONDS

LoansBtwnOrgInterestedPrsnGrp.LoanPurposeTxt: LOAN TO FACILITATE MOVE TO CT

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL UTILIZES THE SERVICES OF STOCK BROKER FIRMS TO SELL DONATED SECURITIES. CASH IS THEN TRANSFERRED TO THE SCHOOL'S BANK ACCOUNT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE MANAGEMENT OF THE SCHOOL DISTRIBUTES THE DRAFT COPY OF THE FORM 990 TO THE ENTIRE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. MANAGEMENT IS AVAILABLE FOR ANY QUESTIONS BOARD MEMBERS MAY HAVE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL'S AUDIT COMMITTEE DOES AN INVENTORY OF EACH RESPONDENT'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST QUESTIONNAIRE BEFORE EACH APRIL MEETING. THE AUDIT COMMITTEE ENSURES THERE IS A 100% RESPONSE RATE. THE TRUSTEESHIP COMMITTEE FOLLOWS UP ON CONFLICTS THAT ARE DISCLOSED, IF ANY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES MEETS ONCE A YEAR TO DISCUSS AND REVIEW THE HEADMASTER'S AND SENIOR ADMINISTRATORS' COMPENSATION. THE CFO PROVIDES SALARY HISTORY AND COMPARISONS FROM ABOPS AND/OR NACUBO OR OTHER THIRD PARTY SOURCES TO THE COMMITTEE FOR THE HEADMASTER AND SENIOR ADMINISTRATORS AND MAKES A RECOMMENDATION OF INCREASES BASED ON FACULTY COMPENSATION POOL (PERCENT OF INCREASE). FROM TIME-TO-TIME, A PRIVATE CONSULTANT IS CONTRACTED TO PERFORM INDEPENDENT ANALYSIS OF COMPENSATION PACKAGES AND ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH IRS REGULATIONS OF THE INTERMEDIATE SANCTIONS ACT AND REBUTTABLE PRESUMPTION OF REASONABLENESS TESTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL MAKES ITS 990 AND AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. THE SCHOOL DOES NOT MAKE ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS OR ITS CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC.
BENEFITS PAID ON ANNUITY OBLIGATIONS -494,249. UNREALIZED LOSS ON INTEREST RATE SWAP -2,710,096.
THE ORGANIZATION HAS AN AUDIT COMMITTEE WHICH OVERSEES THE WORK OF ITS INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANTS, AND IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THEIR SELECTION.
